content.description:
The following questions refer to this passage:

lucundum, mea vita, mihi proponis amorem
 hunc nostrum inter nos perpetuumque fore.
Di magni, facite ut vere promittere possit,
 atque id sincere dicat et ex animo.
content.question: What two things does Catullus ask the gods to do in lines 3-4 (Di . . . animo)? Write out and translate two Latin clauses to support your answer.

frqParts.text: What two things does Catullus ask the gods to do in lines 3-4 (Di . . . animo)? Write out and translate two Latin clauses to support your answer.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
